pages.text: Siberion comes from the lower Cambrian, with fossils found in the Sinsk Formation, Siberia (Russia). It is a small lobopodian, growing up to 5.5 cm in length. Even with its simple lobopodian body-plan, it has some defining features, like the shape of its 'tail' and body, and the prominent grasping appendages on its head, which have been noted to share some phylogenetic similarities to the family Anomalocarididae. A digestive tract has also been preserved in one of

the two fossil specimens we have, which has been suggested to be similar to the Stem group Dinocaridida, which itself contains Anomalocarididae. The generic name derives from the Latinised name for Siberia, where it was found.
